On the other side, Neo Arcadia was again under the control of Copy X, who was being carefully watched by the Four Guardians, who were also revealed to have survived the incident. However, this meant things got terribly boring. Sure, there was an occasional Maverick attack every once in a while, but such problems were easily dealt with. So, day in, day out, there was nothing to do.

And it was the beginning of just one of those days.

Zero was pulling on his armor and clothes in the Resistance Base and staring at himself in the mirror. He looked the same at he always did. Nothing had changed. Smirking slightly, he slipped on his gauntlets, his boots, his vest, and finally his helmet before walking out the door and into the hallway. He was going to pick something up.

The young scientist and leader of the Resistance was still the same as ever, except for, perhaps, her apparent liking for Zero as more than a friend. It was no secret that Ciel liked, or even loved, the legendary Reploid, and many a time Zero had noticed other Resistance members smirking knowingly when he ever talked to her at length.

Zero didn't really like Ciel in that way, he was perfectly fine being her friend. At least, that's what he thought.

Apparently he liked it. And this was the reason why he was here.

The crimson Reploid had stopped in front of an abandoned room on the bottom floor.
